name: @seneca/s3-store
description: Entity store using AWS S3. Note: *not* for arbitrary binaries, just for Seneca data entities.

scripts.test: lab -v -P test -t 50 -l --sourcemaps --transform node_modules/lab-transform-typescript -I @@any-promise/REGISTRATION -r console -o stdout -r html -o test/coverage.html
scripts.reset: npm run clean && npm i && npm run build && npm test
scripts.repo-tag: REPO_VERSION=`node -e "console.log(require('./package').version)"` && echo TAG: v$REPO_VERSION && git commit -a -m v$REPO_VERSION && git push && git tag v$REPO_VERSION && git push --tags;
scripts.repo-publish: npm run clean && npm i && npm run build && npm run repo-publish-quick
scripts.repo-publish-quick: npm run prettier && npm run build && npm run test && npm run repo-tag && npm publish --registry https://registry.npmjs.org --access public

author: Richard Rodger @rjrodger
